FuncDef:
The nqa test-flow command creates an NQA test flow and displays the NQA test flow view.
The undo nqa test-flow command deletes an NQA test flow.
By default, no NQA test flow is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a test flow.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An NQA test flow provides the following functions:
Describes test traffic characteristics, such as the source MAC address, destination MAC address, source IP address, and destination IP address.Specifies service attributes, such as the CIR and EIR.Specifies service quality parameters, such as the FLR, FTD, and FDV.
To create an NQA test flow in an Ethernet service activation test, run the nqa test-flow command.
